lines.text: What a rotten film. All we meet are crazy people.
Are you in a film or in reality?
In a film? You lie too much.
This isn't a novel, this is a film. A film is life.
Didn't you heard what he said? Marx says we're all brothers!
Marx didn't said that. Some other communist said that. Jesus said that.
It's rotten of us, isn't it? We've no right to burn even a philosopher.
Can't you see they're only imaginary characters?
We're little more than that ourselves.
I am here to inform these modern times of the grammatical era's end and the beginning of flamboyance especially in cinema.

[in the midst of a bourgeois' car collision]
From French Revolutions to Gaullist weekends, freedom is violence.
